problem.markdown:
1. An impulse applied to a body causes its momentum to change and is equal to that change in momentum. (x) True () False
2) Newton's third law applies, and the impulse on the colliding objects will be equal and opposite. (x) True () False
3) Momentum is the product of the mass and acceleration of an object. () True (x) False
4) During the force-rise phase the system oscillates at the natural period about the static solution () True (x) False
5) If the velocity is zero at the end of the ramp, the system vibrates during constant-force phase (x) True () False
problem.p: 1. An impulse applied to a body causes its momentum to change and is equal to that change in momentum.
2) Newton's third law applies, and the impulse on the colliding objects will be equal and opposite.
3) Momentum is the product of the mass and acceleration of an object.
4) During the force-rise phase the system oscillates at the natural period about the static solution
5) If the velocity is zero at the end of the ramp, the system vibrates during constant-force phase
